pullrequest.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

content.raw:
I took a look at this and there seems to be a problem loading `camera.world` within a QTest. I ticketed issue #1996.

Could you change the test to use `imu_demo.world` instead please? That world has a sensor and I verified that it doesn't crash the test. Thanks!
content.html:
I took a look at this and there seems to be a problem loading camera.world within a QTest. I ticketed issue #1996.

Could you change the test to use imu_demo.world instead please? That world has a sensor and I verified that it doesn't crash the test. Thanks!

pullrequest.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

content.raw:
So if I understand correctly, this is checking one level deeper for an item which matches `selectedEntityName`, correct? This looks very similar to the functionality provided by `ModelListWidget::ListItem`, used above. We can leave it like this for now, but it might be interesting to reimplement `ListItem` in a recursive way so that it can check an indefinite depth. This will be especially helpful to start displaying nested models in the panel correctly.

I imagine it will look very similar to what we do in the model editor with [ModelTreeWidget::FindItemByData](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/4004fbd7deede758c0ca0fbc7c906e62b0a808a4/gazebo/gui/model/ModelTreeWidget.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ModelTreeWidget.cc-632)
content.html:
So if I understand correctly, this is checking one level deeper for an item which matches selectedEntityName, correct? This looks very similar to the functionality provided by ModelListWidget::ListItem, used above. We can leave it like this for now, but it might be interesting to reimplement ListItem in a recursive way so that it can check an indefinite depth. This will be especially helpful to start displaying nested models in the panel correctly.

I imagine it will look very similar to what we do in the model editor with ModelTreeWidget::FindItemByData

content.raw: The `requestPub` you're resetting here is the one inherited from `physics::Entity`. And `requestPub` is actually used at `Entity::Fini`, so do you mind not resetting it here?
content.html: The requestPub you're resetting here is the one inherited from physics::Entity. And requestPub is actually used at Entity::Fini, so do you mind not resetting it here?

pullrequest.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties
Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

content.raw:
An update, we're working on an implementation for the backend which uses ign-transport services. At the moment, we have a couple of options:

1. Decline this PR and wait for it to come in an ignition form. That will take a bit to come because it depends on other pull requests. 

1. Accept this PR as it is, and refactor the backend later to use ignition. Most of the GUI stuff added in this PR, including the tests, won't change.
content.html:
An update, we're working on an implementation for the backend which uses ign-transport services. At the moment, we have a couple of options:

  1. Decline this PR and wait for it to come in an ignition form. That will take a bit to come because it depends on other pull requests.

  2. Accept this PR as it is, and refactor the backend later to use ignition. Most of the GUI stuff added in this PR, including the tests, won't change.

pullrequest.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

content.raw:
It looks like the default branch in your repo has been compromised and there are some conflicts. You can try merging with the latest revision of osrf's default, which is the one on the top of [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/branch/default) page. At the moment, it would be:

`hg merge -r b0fb882`
